strcpy performance test

The performance and optimzation test for strcpy. Uses the framework provided by "test_" Test framework for performance testing and "loop_" Standard loops for testing and reporting. More...
Status

The testing and optimization has been completed

Results

  • Winner: lx_strcpy_r3() 1.65x performance gain on LX
  • Honorable mention: lx_strcpy_5a() 1.2x peformance gain on K7
Candidates
  • lx_strcpy_r3()
  • lx_strcpy_r4()
  • lx_strcpy_5a()
  • lx_strcpy_5a_r()
Notes Reference is made to the 'Darwin "magic" algorithm.' By this we are referring to the dword zero find algorithm which uses the 0xfefefeff "magic" number. This is similar to (and mathematically equivalent to) the i586 implementation but is implemented in fewer instructions and fewer conditional jumps.

Note also that as the Darwin code was PPC assembly, thus only the algorithm and not the implementation is reflected in the implementation here.
